org.cmapi.primitives

Interface IGeoLookAt

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IGeoAltitudeMode, IGeoBase, IGeoPosition
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    ILookAt
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    GeoLookAt, LookAt

    public interface IGeoLookAt
extends IGeoBase, IGeoAltitudeMode, IGeoPosition
    The LookAt element positions the 'camera' in relation to the IGeoPosition that is being viewed

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface org.cmapi.primitives.IGeoAltitudeMode

        IGeoAltitudeMode.AltitudeMode

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • setTilt

        void setTilt(double tilt)
        Rotation, in degrees, of the camera around the X axis. A value of 0 indicates that the view is aimed straight down toward the earth (the most common case). A value for 90 for indicates that the view is aimed toward the horizon. Values greater than 90 indicate that the view is pointed up into the sky. Values for are clamped at +180 degrees.

      • getTilt

        double getTilt()

      • setHeading

        void setHeading(double heading)
        Direction (that is, North, South, East, West), in degrees. Default=0 (North). Values range from 0 to 360 degrees

      • getHeading

        double getHeading()

      • setRange

        void setRange(double range)
        Distance in meters from the point specified by IGeoPosition to the LookAt position

      • getRange

        double getRange()
